http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20070604/ap_on_go_co/congressman_probe;_ylt=AoS7H2lGd1wyo3V.fuhb9Q2s0NUE
 
 
 
 Rep. Jefferson indicted in bribery probe 
 
 
 By LARA JAKES JORDAN and MATTHEW BARAKAT, Associated Press Writer 
 56 minutes ago
 
 
 
 WASHINGTON - Louisiana congressman William Jefferson (news, bio, voting record) received more than $500,000 in bribes and sought millions more in nearly a dozen separate schemes to enrich himself by using his office to broker business deals in Africa, according to a federal indictment Monday. 
 
 The charges came almost two years after investigators raided Jefferson's home in Washington and found $90,000 in cash stuffed in his freezer.
 
 The indictment lists 16 counts, including racketeering, soliciting bribes, wire fraud, money laundering, obstruction of justice and conspiracy. He faces a possible maximum sentence of 235 years.
 
 He is the first U.S. official to face charges under the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act, which prohibits corporate bribery overseas.
 
 Jefferson, through his lawyer, claimed innocence. He will be arraigned Friday in U.S. District Court in Alexandria.
 
 The schemes were complicated and Jefferson set up front companies to hide the money and disperse it to family members, prosecutors said.
 
 "But the essence of the charges are really very simple: Mr. Jefferson corruptly traded on his good office and on the Congress," said Chuck Rosenberg, the U.S. attorney in Alexandria.[/quote]
 
 =snip=

post_info.post_title: Still think Democrats have the moral high ground?

Think again!!!
 
 At least when Republicans get caught with their hands in the cookie jar, they have sense enough to resign.
I, for one, never thought they did. I support the democrats because they are not nazis unlike the republicans.
if you think that either of the two parties has any morals in the first place, much less moral high ground, I have a ocean to sell you in the middle of the Sahara.

Neither party has the moral high ground. Both parties suck. They're too caught up with the morals of the past to know what good for the world of today. Politicians on all ends of the spectrum have their heads shoved up their asses, unaware of all the corruption in their so-called "freedom-exporting" government.
 
 I don't care which party is highest on the moral meter, both are low beyond saving.
Bassman, don't tell me you're ceding the moral high ground to Republicans.
